title: THRIFT-4857: Made Java TField class hash code consistent with equals.
body:
Client: java

This change fixes a bug in which the `TField` class was broken with respect to the `Object` API requirements for `hashCode()` and `equals()` being consistent, as explained in [THRIFT-4857](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-4857).

As this class had no unit tests, and I'm not yet ready to install the entire build infrastructure on my Windows machine, I did not add any unit tests.

I have my own opinions about approaches to generating hash codes, as well comments about the approach to checking for class equivalence, but those issues are separate from the central hash code bug. As this is my first contribution, I therefore made my change as surgical as possible.

title: THRIFT-2059: Support for Enums in Python >= 3.4
body:
<!-- Explain the changes in the pull request below: -->
Currently in Python, the generated enum classes for enum thrift objects, are not being used in deserialization (or serialization). This means that the string representations of enums are never used. Moving one step further than the patch contained in THRIFT-2059, this creates python IntEnum classes and retrieves the string representation on deserialization while storing the integer representation on serialization.

title: Enables changing 'UserAgent'
body: `.Net` does not allow modifying several `known-headers` using `customHeaders`. So, there's no way to change `User-Agent` with the current C# implementation unlike other languages can do.

title: THRIFT-4846. Topologically sort structs before generation
body:
This adds a toposort step prior to emitting generating code for structs.
For many languages (eg Java) this isn't necessary as there is no
"ordering" in the generated code. However, with C and C++, it's
important to define structs prior to their inclusion in another struct.

This also makes Thrift fail when generating C/C++ code with cyclic
references as the toposort is impossible.

A new test includes some structs defined in the "wrong" order to ensure
that the sort produces working code.

I manually tested a file with a true cycle in it, and verified the error
output.

title: THRIFT-3060: clear the offline queue when written
body:
This PR addresses an issue in the NodeJS module where data would be sent multiple times when the socket reconnects multiple times because the `offline_queue` would never be emptied.

This fix clears the `offline_queue` when the socket reconnects and the queued data is written. 

Fixes [THRIFT-3060](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-3060).

title: THRIFT-4845: Stop ignoring small timeouts
body:
Client: php

CURLOPT_TIMEOUT requires a long [0], so it seems that small values
like 0.2 are being rounded to 0, resulting in a lack of any timeout.

This change uses CURLOPT_TIMEOUT_MS, which the PHP documentation
says was "added in cURL 7.16.2. Available since PHP 5.2.3."

[0] https://curl.haxx.se/libcurl/c/CURLOPT_TIMEOUT.html

title: THRIFT-4844: createConnection ignores connect_timeout option
body:
To fix the defect I passed connect_timeout option or timeout option directly to net.createConnection.
This allows to use the nodeJs's internal mechanism for connection timeout handling.

title: THRIFT-4809: Implement episodic compilation for js code generation
body:
Implement episodic compilation for js code generation

Two new options are:
`thrift_package_output_directory`: If set, the generator will create an episode file `thrift.js.episode` that will contain the import paths of the generated modules. `thrift_package_output_directory` will be a prefix for the import path. This episode file then should be placed in the root of the node_module.

`imports`: The `:` separated paths of node_modules to import from. The node_module must have `thrift.js.episode` file in the module root. This option is mutually exclusive with `-recurse` option.

title: THRIFT-4807: Fix php segfault on reference pass
body:
Client: php (extension)

When reference is passed to php extension, it's unreferenced (instead of
derefrenced). The next time one tries to use the same variable PHP
segaults. Even if not used again, php segfaults on
user_shutdown_function_call.

Tested by rerunning code in Jira THRIFT-4807 with the patch - passes

title: THRIFT-4805: Suppress excessive logging of SASL TTransportExceptions in case of END_OF_FILE
body:
Two fixes here:

1. Additional logic to properly catch and handle TTransportException.
   Currently, T(SASL)TransportException gets caught and handled in
   the wrong catch-block.
2. The fix for THRIFT-3769 mutes _all_ TTransportExceptions in TThreadPoolServer.
   This might mute legitimate failures. The intent of THRIFT-3769 (and
   THRIFT-2268) was to mute the noise caused by TTransportException.END_OF_FILE.
   This commit lets legitimate failures to be bubbled upwards.

title: THRIFT-4805: Fix THRIFT-3769, THRIFT-2268
body:
Two fixes here:
1. Additional logic to properly catch and handle TTransportException.
    Currently, T(SASL)TransportException gets caught and handled in
    the wrong catch-block.
2. The fix for THRIFT-3769 mutes *all* TTransportExceptions in TThreadPoolServer.
    This might mute legitimate failures. The intent of THRIFT-3769 (and
    THRIFT-2268) was to mute the noise caused by TTransportException.END_OF_FILE.
    This commit lets legitimate failures to be bubbled upwards.

title: [THRIFT-4771] add nodejs THeaderProtocol support
body:
<!-- Explain the changes in the pull request below: -->
  
For nodejs

This implements a subset of THeaderProtocol.
- [x] Supports TCompact and TBinaryProtocols framed/unframed for backward compatibility.
- [x] Supports buffered and framed transports

Does not support:
- Transforms
- HTTP
- Automatic detection of framed vs unframed transport. This is something I would like to address sometime in the near future in a separate PR

title: THRIFT-4024, THRIFT-4783: throw when skipping invalid type
body:
Modify protocol skip code to throw when encountering an unexpected type. - [ ] Did you squash your changes to a single commit? - [x] Do you need an [Apache Jira](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/THRIFT/issues/) ticket?
Expand for guidance... - `Yes` if your change requires a release note. - `Yes` if your change is a breaking change. - `No` if you change is trivial, such as fixing a typo.
- [x] Is this change worthy of a release note?
Examples of Release Note-worthy examples... - Breaking Changes - New, Deprecated, or Removed Languages - Security Fixes - Significant Refactoring - Changing how the product is built
- [ ] Breaking changes have additional requirements:
Expand for instructions... - Add or reference an existing Apache Jira THRIFT ticket. - Add a `Breaking-Change` label to the Jira ticket. - Add a note to the `lib//README.md` file. - Add a line to the `CHANGES.md` file.

title: THRIFT-4798: fix py/py3 server, java client with http transport
body:
The java TestClient asks the server to runa oneway request that sleeps for 3 seconds. If the java TestClient sees the duration of the call exceed one second, it fails the test. This means the server did not participate in the "fire and forget" dynamics of ONEWAY requests. In this case the THttpServer was processing the RPC before sending the transport response. The fix was to enhance the TProcessor so that the THttpServer has an opportunity to inspect the message header before processing the RPC. This is partly due to the violation of the THttpServer in the layered architecture. It is essentially implementing a combined server and transport, whereas there should be a distinct server, protocol, and transport separation. Many languages seem to have this problem where HTTP was introduced. I can't say this is the best solution possible, but it is one solution. In general, ONEWAY request dynamics over HTTP are broken in Apache Thrift and I'm not sure what the best source of action is with respect to that yet. - [x] Did you squash your changes to a single commit? - [x] Do you need an [Apache Jira](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/THRIFT/issues/) ticket?

title: THRIFT-3707, THRIFT-1383: disallow spaces or dashes in thrift filenames for python generation
body:
It is not valid to have a module name with space or dash in it. This makes it impossible (generation fails) if there is a dash or space in the thrift filename. ``` root@065b5a8a24b9:/tmp# /thrift/src/compiler/cpp/thrift -v --gen py "Enum Test.thrift" Scanning /tmp/Enum Test.thrift for includes Parsing /tmp/Enum Test.thrift for types Program: /tmp/Enum Test.thrift [FAILURE:generation:1] Error: space or dash detected in thrift filename 'Enum Test.thrift' - invalid for python modules root@065b5a8a24b9:/tmp# /thrift/src/compiler/cpp/thrift -v --gen py "Enum-Test.thrift" Scanning /tmp/Enum-Test.thrift for includes Parsing /tmp/Enum-Test.thrift for types Program: /tmp/Enum-Test.thrift [FAILURE:generation:1] Error: space or dash detected in thrift filename 'Enum-Test.thrift' - invalid for python modules root@065b5a8a24b9:/tmp# /thrift/src/compiler/cpp/thrift -v --gen py "Enum_Test.thrift" Scanning /tmp/Enum_Test.thrift for includes Parsing /tmp/Enum_Test.thrift for types Program: /tmp/Enum_Test.thrift Generating "py" ``` Review the following checklist to ensure a smooth pull request experience. - [x] Did you squash your changes to a single commit? - [x] Do you need an [Apache Jira](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/THRIFT/issues/) ticket?

  - [ ] Is the [Apache Jira](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/THRIFT/issues/) THRIFT ticket identifier in the PR title?

        THRIFT-9999: an example pull request title

  - [ ] Is the [Apache Jira](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/THRIFT/issues/) THRIFT ticket identifier and affected languages in the commit message?

        THRIFT-9999: [summary of fix, one line if possible]
        Client: [language(s) affected, comma separated, use lib/ directory names please]

- [ ] Did you squash your changes to a single commit?

        Committers can squash when they merge, but sometimes we forget, and it makes the history
        pretty dirty.  Please squash your pull requests to a single commit if you can.

For more information about committing, see CONTRIBUTING.md

title: THRIFT-4405: identify and fix sequence id handling errors
body:
The following tests were added:

- The cpp client for cross test now uses a sequence ID that starts at INT32_MAX - 10, and advances until it wraps around.
- The cpp client verifies the sequence ID that returns matches what was sent.
- The python client was changed to use pedantic sequence ID checking on all protocols.

The following errors were identified and fixed:

- In c_glib, thrift_stored_message_protocol was limiting the sequence ID to [0..G_INTMAX].  This was changed to allow any 32-bit value, matching other implementations.
- In cpp, JSON protocol, when the server read the header, it used a uint64_t for processing; this interacted with a bugfix from 2017 that dropped boost::lexical_cast and switched to std::stringstream, and this corrupted the negative sequence IDs.
- In python, compact protocol, a negative sequence ID was not handled properly.

Documentation was added for sequence number handling.

title: THRIFT-4763: HTML compiler produces invalid HTML document
body:
Steps to reproduce: - Create an simple thrift file like the following: service MyService {} - generate the HTML documentation for it via thrift -gen html MyService.thrift The HTML compiler generates the following invalid stream: ``` }} Thrift module: test

Thrift module: test

ModuleServicesData typesConstants
testMyService

Services

Service: MyService

```

title: THRIFT-4762: Applied some C++11 refactorings to the runtime library and compiler
body:
I basically used clang-tidy to apply the following C++11 refactorings (which make very much sense to me)

- make use of `override` keyword whenever a virtual function is overwritten
- make use of `auto` keyword for iterators
- make use of `auto` keyword when every a redundancy can be avoided, e.g. 
`uint32_t len = static_cast<uint32_t>(str.length());
vs.
`auto len = static_cast<uint32_t>(str.length());`
- replaced `NULL` with `nullptr`
- make use of explicitly-defaulted function definition

Additionally, I applied some more const-correctness to some functions.

title: THRIFT-4384: fix concurrent sync in cpp async client code
body:
THRIFT-4384: the StressTest was not being run in concurrency mode so I added that to the cmake build and I implemented the fix proposed in THRIFT-4384 to make it work properly, although it had to change somewhat.

THRIFT-4739: timer manager test 4 was assuming a thread was exiting quickly, it needed additional logic since the notify call used to manage the test behavior was coming from inside the thread, not from the timer manager

title: THRIFT-1549: properly unwrap and close TSSLSocket in python
THRIFT-4743: remove cpp compiler plugin support to simplify the project
THRIFT-4757: fix npm identified security vulnerability in transient dependency on sync-exec
body: The direct dependency `grunt-shell-spawn` was updated to no longer need `sync-exec`.  Also fixed version and package meta for `lib/ts`.

body: add thrift export to fix windows shared lib building

title: THRIFT-4759: Adding cmake-generated header for symbol visibility
THRIFT-4760: Configure and install pkgconfig files when using cmake
body:
The pkgconfig files are currently only installed when using autotools.

It's not too hard to install them using cmake, and it's nice for 3rd party projects which don't themselves use cmake

title: THRIFT-4753: re-version master to 0.13.0, the next release, and do some autoconf cleanup
body: The autoconf work was intended to allow "make dist" to work at any time, but for making a release it is safer to pull a fresh clone and make dist in that (that's what's in the release documentation now).

title: THRIFT-4723 Consolidate C#/netcore into new netstd language target
body:
Client: netstd
Patch: Jens Geyer

Both C# and netcore are left untouched by this. Removal of these parts is a separate step, deprecation should be announced before 0.13.0, but actually be done after 0.13.0 (personal opinion, to be discussed).

lib/netstd/README.md contains a migration roadmap for both cases, listing all the things I ran into while porting over certain Thrift Projects and some of my own projects. It dos not claim to be complete, but it should provide a fairly good overview of the process.

title: THRIFT-4752: Added cmake package configuration for cpp and compiler
body:
This pull request is loosely inspired by the cmake documentation and by the hunter-package cmake package configuration at https://github.com/hunter-packages/thrift/.

The PR adds support for the cpp library, transitive library dependencies and and the thrift compiler in a cmake package configuration.

With the PR in place, users can
```
find_package(thrift)
```
without the need for a `FindThrift.cmake` script.

title: THRIFT-4751: Missing imports in TProtocol (phpdoc related only)
body:
Client: php

TProtocol interface use phpdoc `@return` tags without corresponding imports. This cause some (minor) issues with IDEs and static analysis tools like phpstan.

title: THRIFT-4723 Consolidate C#/netcore into new netstd language target
body:
Client: netstd
Patch: Jens Geyer

Both C# and netcore are left untouched by this. Removal of these parts is a separate step, deprecation should be announced before 0.13.0, but actually be done after 0.13.0 (personal opinion, to be discussed).

I might add, that the lib/netstd/README.md contains a migration roadmap for both cases, listing all the things I ran into while porting over certain Thrift Projects and some of my own projects. It dos not claim to be complete, but it should provide a fairly good overview of the process.

title: THRIFT-4750: as3 changes to build and publish to maven central
body: These changes allowed me to not only publish libthrift-as3 version 0.12.0 to maven central but I was also able to work it into the docker image, and now as3 builds with autoconf builds on Travis CI.  This is the first release mode build of libthrift-as3 to maven central; all previous builds were debug builds.  It hadn't been published since version 0.9.0 (it also may not have changed much since then..)

title: THRIFT-4675: Fix i64 map key generation for js
body:
In the past, i64 map keys were generated as numbers. However it was broken with #1684

Since js keys can only be strings, the numbers were implicitly converted to strings. This PR explicitly uses strings for i64 map keys since some i64 values cannot be represented as a string on javascript.
